### Variables

Did you think your Story can only give options to choose from? Well, you were wrong! Introducing, as you have might already guessed, **variables**!

## General

What are variables? In a nutshell, you can store data in them.

Apollo currently supports three types of variables:
- Text
- Numbers
- True/False (so-called *boolean*, or *bool* for short)

The thing is, in order to use variables, you have to declare them. How? Let's find out!

## *Variables* window

![Variables window](data:image/png;base64,)

Variables cosnsist of two things:
- *Name*, which is an **unique** identifier for variable. If you try creating a variable with name that already exists, a number will be appended.
- *Value*, which is default variable's value at the beginning of your Story.

### Adding variables

To add variable, press button with a plus on the bottom left, it will add new variable called *&lt;New&gt;*

### Removing variables

You see that button with a minus? You know what to do.

### Editing variables

To edit any property of variable, simply double click on it.

## Using variables

To use variable in text, you can select it from *Insert variable* dropdown in editor, or use `v` tag (see [Tags](Tags) for more).

To use variable in Expression (see [Expressions](Expressions)), you can get its value with `@{variable name}`.
